text:
So, we used to use Bors on the Pkg.jl repo, and we got rid of it a while back (which I think was a good decision).

At that time, I remember some people (e.g <@U67D54KS8>) pointing out that it would be good to have some option for "auto-merge a PR once tests are passing".

Well, GitHub now has that option built in. Basically, you can tell GitHub "once the required status checks are passing, merge this PR." You can select the merge method (merge, squash, rebase, etc.) on a per-PR basis. You can also cancel an auto-merge at any time.

Would we like to enable this PR on the Pkg.jl repo?

The one caveat is this: in order for this feature to be enabled, we need to mark at least one status check as a "required" status check. Then GitHub will auto-merge once all "required" status checks are green.

More details: <https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/automatically-merging-a-pull-request>

elements.text:
So, we used to use Bors on the Pkg.jl repo, and we got rid of it a while back (which I think was a good decision).

At that time, I remember some people (e.g

) pointing out that it would be good to have some option for "auto-merge a PR once tests are passing".

Well, GitHub now has that option built in. Basically, you can tell GitHub "once the required status checks are passing, merge this PR." You can select the merge method (merge, squash, rebase, etc.) on a per-PR basis. You can also cancel an auto-merge at any time.

Would we like to enable this PR on the Pkg.jl repo?

The one caveat is this: in order for this feature to be enabled, we need to mark at least one status check as a "required" status check. Then GitHub will auto-merge once all "required" status checks are green.

More details:

yeah, you can’t trust `HEAD`  to be provided in general.
In theory HTTP 1.1 requires `HEAD` and `GET`  of “general-purpose servers” (<https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-5.1.1>)
but HTTP 1.0 (<https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1945>) doesn’t require it.
and in practice it sometimes isn’t implemented.
I ran into this for DataDeps.jl that wanted to use the header to findout the filename.

elements.text:
to be provided in general.
In theory HTTP 1.1 requires

text: Which method is preferred?

Anyone want to discuss:

There are two solutions to <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/38411>:

One involves   `chmod` every `mkdir` operation to ensure mode `0o777` is actually true  on Windows.

The second is preemptively creating `.julia` in Pkg.jl and ensuring `chmod` is correct.

text:
This inconsistency trips me up at times
```$ ls

$ JULIA_LOAD_PATH=$PWD julia -E 'Base.active_project()'
nothing

$ JULIA_LOAD_PATH=$PWD/Project.toml julia -E 'Base.active_project()'
"/tmp/tmp.MFtLdqSxfM/Project.toml"

$ julia --project=$PWD -E 'Base.active_project()'
"/tmp/tmp.MFtLdqSxfM/Project.toml"

$ julia --project=$PWD/Project.toml -E 'Base.active_project()'
"/tmp/tmp.MFtLdqSxfM/Project.toml"```
but looks like it is needed to support package directories in load path...

text:
Hello! We've noticed quite a few people being confused by the "big error dump" that could occur when testing packages e.g.
```(Foo) pkg> test
    Testing Foo
┌ Error: Pkg.Resolve.ResolverError("Unsatisfiable requirements detected...```
and which was fixed by <https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/pull/2232> :tada:
Since this fix is such a big quality of life improvement, i wanted to check if it will be included in Julia 1.6?
Also, is there some way i could have checked this myself (short of building the 1.6 branch)?
(I see it is in nightly, but that's 1.7 now)

elements.text: Hello! We've noticed quite a few people being confused by the "big error dump" that could occur when testing packages e.g.

(Foo) pkg> test
    Testing Foo
┌ Error: Pkg.Resolve.ResolverError("Unsatisfiable requirements detected...

Since this fix is such a big quality of life improvement, i wanted to check if it will be included in Julia 1.6?
Also, is there some way i could have checked this myself (short of building the 1.6 branch)?

text:
for a private registry i have cloned,
on julia 1.6 and 1.7 I am seening
```    Updating git-repo `<mailto:git@gitlab.invenia.ca|git@gitlab.invenia.ca>:invenia/PackageRegistry.git`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.```
But not on 1.5
what could be up with that?

elements.text:
for a private registry i have cloned,
on julia 1.6 and 1.7 I am seening

Updating git-repo `git@gitlab.invenia.ca:invenia/PackageRegistry.git`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `gitlab.invenia.ca` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.

But not on 1.5
what could be up with that?
